Text: Brabejum is a genus of a single species of large evergreen tree, Brabejum stellatifolium in the Proteaceae, commonly called wild almond, bitter almond or ghoeboontjie.
Triplets:<Brabejum
2:
--------------------
<Text: Brabejum:  The plant is of botanical interest as being Africa's only member of the large grevilleoid subfamily.>
Triplets:<Brabejum
4:
--------------------
Text: Brabejum:  Leaves to 6 in (15 cm) long, narrow and bluntly toothed, appear at intervals along the branches, mostly in whorls of 6.
Triplets:<Brabejum
5:
--------------------
<Text: Brabejum:  In summer, the plant bears white flowers densely crowded on spikes arising from rusty buds at the leaf axils.>
Triplets:<Brabejum
6:
--------------------
Text: Brabejum:  The fruits to 2 in (5 cm) long, magenta to reddish brown, similar to an almond, appear in autumn.
